title: Optimization of polyphenol extraction from grape waste
source: Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry

tittle: Hydro-alcoholic extraction kinetics of phenolics from oregano: Optimization of the extraction parameters
pretreatment_notes: Dried oregano was subjected to 6 h of water-steam distillation to remove essential oil. The wet residue was air-dried at 35 °C for 24 h and then ground in a blender and sieved to obtain multiple particle size fractions, ranging from 157.5 um to 1250 um. A batch of distilled, non-ground material 1100 um was also tested.

tittle: Extraction Kinetics of Phenolic Antioxidants from the Hydro Distillation Residues of Rosemary and Effect of Pretreatment and Extraction Parameters
pretreatment_notes: Commercial rosemary was subjected to 6 h of water-steam distillation to remove essential oil. The wet residue was dried at 35 °C for 24 h, and the ground and fractioned into multiple particle sizes. Additionally, the ground material was subjected to two pre-extraction treatments: maceration or pulsed electric fields.

tittle: Kinetic modelling of the solid–liquid extraction process of polyphenolic compounds from apple pomace: influence of solvent composition and temperature
pretreatment_notes: The samples (flesh, skin, seeds, and stems) were dried at 60 °C for 24 h, then ground and sieved to 0.25 mm.

tittle: Extraction Kinetics of Total Polyphenols, Flavonoids, and Condensed Tannins of Lentil Seed Coat: Comparison of Solvent and Extraction Methods
matrix_botanical_name: Lens culinaris L., Lens esculenta Moench
pretreatment_notes: Laird variety lentils were subjected to dehulling. The hull was collected and vacuum -packed.

tittle: Kinetic modelling of total phenolic compounds from Ilex paraguariensis (St Hil) leaves: Conventional and ultrasound assisted extraction
pretreatment_notes: Yerba Mate (thick leaf fraction) was received dried and ground. The matrix was used as: 1) a coarse commercial fraction (for kinetics study) and 2) a fine fraction that was additionally ground and sieved into 4 classes, with particle sizes between 297 µm and 500 µm (for optimization study).
comments: For maceration only the finest fraction was used. For the four particle classes were indicated the mean particle size.

tittle: Effect of Ethanol/Water Solvents on Phenolic Profiles and Antioxidant Properties of Beijing Propolis Extracts
pretreatment_notes: Raw propolis was directly collected from hives of Apis mellifera L. The sample was frozen at −18°C for 4 hours and then crushed into homogeneous powder
quantification_methods: FC, TFC, HPLC-DAD, DPPH, ABTS, FRAP, ORAC, Cell antioxidant
comments: propolis recolected from chinese bee hive

tittle: Spent coffee grounds as a valuable source of phenolic compounds and bioenergy
pretreatment_notes: Residue collected from coffee bars in Rome. Manual removal of matherials other than coffee grounds. The sample was dried in  electric forced-air dehydrator at 40 °C for 12 h. The storaged was in dark at room temperature.

tittle: Spent coffee grounds as a valuable source of phenolic compounds and bioenergy
pretreatment_notes: Residue recovered from coffee capsules. The sample was dried in  electric forced-air dehydrator at 40 °C for 12 h. The storaged was in dark at room temperature.

tittle: Selective extraction process and characterization of antioxidant phenolic compounds (Pereskia aculeate leaves) (estudio comparativo de disolventes / fraccionamiento)
pretreatment_notes: The leaves were provided by a brazilian company, then dried and milled.
quantification_methods: FC, FRAP, DPPH, ABTS, HPLC-DAD, UPLC-MS
comments: Extraction made at room temperature. Only the direct solvent extraction was considered.

tittle: Ultrasound-Assisted Extraction of Phenolic Compounds from Psidium cattleianum Leaves: Optimization Using Response Surface Methodology
Optimization of ultrasound-assisted hydroalcoholic extraction of phenolic compounds from walnut leaves using response surface methodology
comments: Los datos cinéticos se pueden obtemer a partir de la superficie de respuesta modelada. Las concentraciones están referidas al extracto, no a la matriz.

tittle: Temperature-dependent kinetics of grape seed phenolic compounds extraction: experiment and model
pretreatment_notes: The seeds were manually separated from grape pomace provided by a winery after wine making. The seeds were shortly dried, then ground and sieved, collecting the particles smaller than 0.63 mm, with mean particle size of 0.56 mm.

tittle: Optimization and Kinetic Modelling of Hydroxycinnamic Acid Extraction from Anethum graveolens Leaves
pretreatment_notes: Fresh dill leaves were manually colleted and air-dried for 15 days in a shaded, well-ventilated space. The dried leaves were ground and pass throug a 6 mm sieve.
kinetic_models: unsteady-state diffusion, parabolic diffusion, power-law, Ponomaryov, Elovich
comments: The authors only report TPC for two conditions.

tittle: Kinetic modeling of valuable phenolic compounds extraction from strawberry and apple agro-industrial by-products
pretreatment_notes: The apple were selected, washed and disinfected. The apple peel (1 mm thickness) was removed with a knife. Then peel was ground in a mortar to a size <1mm.

tittle: Kinetic modeling of valuable phenolic compounds extraction from strawberry and apple agro-industrial by-products
pretreatment_notes: non edible parts of strawberry (stems, sepals, rest of fruit) was manually removed after harvest, and ground in a mortar to a size <1mm.

tittle: Study of solid–liquid extraction kinetics of total polyphenols from grape seeds
pretreatment_notes: The seeds were manually separated from white grape pomace provided by a winery after wine making and sun-dried. Dried seeds were gorund in a coffe grinder.

tittle:
Optimization Of Polyphenol Recovery And
Antioxidant Activity From Nelumbo Nucifera Leaf
Using Box-Behnken Design And Lc-Hrms Profiling
comments: The extraction temperature is not reported. It does not mention whether or not there is agitation.

tittle: Recovery of essential oils, polyphenols, fermentable sugars, and pectin from orange residues: Evaluation of extraction methodologies and characterization of value-added bioactive compounds
pretreatment_notes: Orange resiudes (peels, seeds, and pulp) were provided by a juice shop. The residues were ground (<5 mm) and dried at 45 °C by convection until mosiure content was <10%.
target_compounds: essential oils, polyphenols, fermentable sugars, and pectin
quantification_methods: FC, HPLC-DAD, HPLC-RID, GC-MS, GC-FID, UHPLC-MS
comments: Report characterization of raw material. Report Cetoh en w/v

tittle: Green Extraction of Bioactive Compounds from Apple Pomace from the Cider Industry
Optimizing the Extraction of Bioactive Compounds (Polyphenols, Lipids, and Alpha-Tocopherol) from Almond Okara to Unlock Its Potential as Functional Food
pretreatment_notes: Almond okara previously blanched (90°C for 3 min) was filtered, and the fresh solid residue was used in extraction.
quantification_methods: FC, Total tannin content, TFC,  phosphomolybdenum, DPPH, UHPLC-UV-MS, SFC

tittle: Efficient recovery of antioxidants from olive leaves through green solvent extraction and enzymatic hydrolysis: Experimental evaluation and COSMO-RS analysis
Optimization of Aqueous Extraction of Polyphenols from Cuminum cyminum Seeds Using Response Surface Methodology and Assessment of Biological Activity
pretreatment_notes: Seeds were crushed with a blade grinder and kept in a dark and cold place for later use
quantification_methods: FC, antibacterial activity, antifungical activity, MIC, anti-tumor activity
comments: Full kinetic data (yield vs. time) is only reported for the optimal solid-to-liquid ratio (S/L) determined in the study. All other S/L ratios tested in the article lack kinetic points.

tittle: Extraction kinetic modelling of total polyphenols and total anthocyanins from saffron floral bio-residues: Comparison of extraction methods
pretreatment_notes: Air-dried at room temperature and milled by a domestic grinder. The powder was stored at 4°C until use.
comments: Particle size and agitation velocity were not reported.

tittle: Extraction Kinetics of phytochemicals and antioxidant activity during black tea (Camellia sinensis L) brewing
pretreatment_notes: tea manufactured according to CTC (Crush, Tear, Curl) process.

tittle: Extraction of Antioxidant Phenolic Compounds from Brewer’s Spent Grain: Optimization and Kinetics Modeling
pretreatment_notes: BSG is the solid waste of wort production in microbrewery. BSG was oven-dried at 60 °C for 24 h and subsequently milled and sieved to obtain particle size less than 0.5 mm.
comments: The yields at 0 time were imputed as 0 mg GAE/g for all the conditions experimented.

tittle: Kinetic modeling of pressure-assisted solvent extraction of polyphenols from green tea in comparison with the conventional extraction
pretreatment_notes: Fresh leaves was air-dried for 24 h at 40 °C, and ground into powder with a mean particle size of 0.4–0.6 mm .

tittle: Kinetic study of polyphenols extraction from olive (Olea europaea L) leaves using instant controlled pressure drop texturing
pretreatment_notes: The leaves were clean with distilled water, then were dried in an airflow oven at 40 °C and ground in a grinder at 10,000 rpm for 1 min.

tittle: Extraction Kinetics of Phenolics from Carob (Ceratonia siliqua L) Kibbles Using Environmentally Benign Solvents
pretreatment_notes: The dry material was powdered using a domestic grinder.

tittle: Aqueous extraction kinetics of phenolic compounds from jamun (Syzygium cumini L) seeds
quantification_methods: FC, TFC, Tannic acid, DPPH, FRAP, HPLC-UV Vis
comments: The material was purchased as dried powder.

tittle: Analysis of Extraction Kinetics of Bioactive Compounds from Spent Coffee Grounds (Coffea arábica)
pretreatment_notes: Coffee grounds were obtained from a coffee machine (Grecas Nacional Coffee - model 1100); that works at 1200 W and the spent coffee grounds are discharged every 2 h.
kinetic_models: Gaussian, Richards, Reciprocal quadratic, Steinhart–Hart, Exponential association 3, Rational, Weibull, Exponential, Bleasdale, Heat capacity, Shifted power, Modified Hoerl

tittle: Kinetics of ultrasound assisted extraction of anthocyanins from Aronia melanocarpa (black chokeberry) wastes
pretreatment_notes: berries was obtained by laboratory extruder pressing. The waste was dried at 45 °C for 2 days.  The material was used as cylindrical pellets (0.3–04 cm diameter) and stored hermetically at room temperature prior to extraction.
comments: The diameter of pellets is taken to be as characteristic lenght, and therefore mean particle size.

tittle: Kinetic Extraction of Total Polyphenols from Pitanga (Eugenia Uniflora L): Effect of Ultrasonic Treatment, Modeling and Antioxidant Potential
pretreatment_notes: Pitanga fruit were air-dried  in oven at 303.15 K and ground in cyclone mill. The particles not retained on 10-mesh sieve were stored.
comments: In the kinetic study, the raw material was charged into the extraction vessel via a protective permeable filter to avoid capturing solids.

tittle:
Extraction of Antioxidants from Grape and Apple Pomace:
Solvent Selection and Process Kinetics
matrix_botanical_name: Malus domestica var. Reineta, Malus domestica var. Fuji
pretreatment_notes: The apple pomace was provided by a spanian company of fruit juice concentrate. The residue was frozen until use.

tittle:
Extraction of Antioxidants from Grape and Apple Pomace:
Solvent Selection and Process Kinetics
pretreatment_notes: The grape pomace was provided by a wine company. The residue was freeze-dried and crushed. The seeds were separated, and remaining skin and flesh was ground and sieve, colecting the <1mm fraction.
